other_tests.findings: Diffuse angioectasia, edematous rectal mucosa, and small ulceration with blood over the recto-sigmoid junction.
Mucosal surface erosion with dense inflammatory cell infiltrate, confirming a diagnosis of grade 2 radiation proctitis.
other_tests.changes_over_time: One month after initiating M-B enema therapy, no ulceration was observed, but the density of telangiectasia remained unchanged. There was a reduced extent of rectal mucosal congestion and hypervascularity, with histopathological analysis showing improvement in inflammatory cell infiltration.
